definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: B. Pick out the proper nouns in the following sentences.
sentences.chinese: 试选出以下句子中的专有名词。

sentences.english: Notice this word, it is a proper noun, so no article is needed.
sentences.chinese: 注意这个单词是一个专有名词，不用冠词。

sentences.english: Proper Nouns Recognition (PNR) is a difficult problem in Chinese information processing.
sentences.chinese: 专有名词识别是中文信息处理领域的一个难题。

sentences.english: You will note that proper nouns begin with a capital letter .
sentences.chinese: 你会注意到专有名词的第一个字母是大写的。

sentences.english: We'll compare common nouns and proper nouns today.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天来比较一下普通名词和专有名词。

sentences.english: Proper nouns deserve an investigation phase of their own.
sentences.chinese: 专有名词值得作进行专门调查。

sentences.english: The proper name is the instantaneous apprehension of a multiplicity.
sentences.chinese: 专有名词就是对于多重性的当下体悟。

sentences.english: So we should take it as a term when punctuating the word "Sishu".
sentences.chinese: 在标点时，“四蜀”应该是一专有名词。

definition: determiner (in grammar, i.e. article, demonstrative, possessive pronoun, noun genitive etc)
vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
variant of 詞彙|词汇[ci2 hui4]
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
